title: The National Audit Bill
decision_details:
- The Cabinet at its meeting held on 15-08-2017 decided to appoint a Ministerial Sub-Committee under the Chairmanship of  Hon. (Dr.) Sarath Amunugama, the Minister of Special Assignments, to recommend appropriate amendments relating to the Draft National Audit Bill focusing attention on various opinions expressed in regard to the said Bill and the relevant legal position relating to this subject prevalent in other countries. 

Accordingly, being compatible with the recommendations of the Ministerial Sub-Committee and the other observations, approval was granted by the Cabinet to pursue further action to amend the Draft National Audit Bill and to incorporate the proposed amendments to vest the authority with the Secretary to relevant Ministry within whose purview the institution in which the officer is serving belongs, to surcharge from the relevant officer any loss caused to the Government due to the negligence, misappropriation, fraud or corruption of  the officer when reported by the Audit Services Commission and to widen the representation of the Surcharge Appeal Committee to be established by the inclusion of two persons representing the fields of Public Administration and Engineering to inquire into the appeals made by a public officer subject to such surcharge.
